intro: Chaetanthera chilensis var. argentea, commonly known as the silver chaetanthera, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Chile. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its hairy, silver-gray foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in umbels. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely used for commercial purposes.
